item.title: Kristin add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Ryunosuke Akutagawa
item.description: "A man sometimes devotes his life to a desire which he is not sure will ever be fulfilled. Those who laugh at this folly are, after all, no more than mere spectators of life." -- Ryunosuke Akutagawa

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Irving Stone
item.description: "There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books." -- Irving Stone

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Zig Ziglar
item.description: "Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis." -- Zig Ziglar

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Howard Nemerov
item.description: "Write what you know. That should leave you with a lot of free time." -- Howard Nemerov

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Kristin add a quote by William Arthur Ward
item.description: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails." -- William Arthur Ward

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Lenore Hershey
item.description: "Do give books - religious or otherwise - for Christmas. They’re never fattening, seldom sinful, and permanently personal." -- Lenore Hershey

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren
